intro: Lysimachia acuminata, commonly known as sharp-leafed yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are characterized by their acute tips. Lysimachia acuminata is often found in wetland habitats and is adapted to thrive in humid, nutrient-rich soils. It plays a role in supporting local wildlife and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
